creator: mling@ucalgary.ca
text:
When a servlet tries to use https protcol via URLConnection, the servlet fails 
with the exception "unknown protocol: https". The Java environment (JDK 1.3) has 
been configuration with JSSE 1.0.2 and the JSSE_HOME environment variable has 
been set.  The servlet works in Tomcat 3.x environment. It appears that the 
Catalina (Tomcat 4.0.1) container ignores the JSSE environment set up in the 
Java environment.

If you've installed JSSE as instructed by the documentation, that is all that's
needed.  Could you please describe where you've installed JSSE, and what you set
JSSE_HOME to?

Alternatively, please try copying the three JSSE jar files (jsse.jar, jcert.jar,
and jnet.jar) into the "common/lib" directory and restart Tomcat.
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com

text:
Check the variable "org.apache.catalina.jsp_classpath" on 'application' in a 
JSP to see what the classpath of your application.
creator: phlat@mindspring.com

text:
I use IBM Java JDK 1.3. and I have installed the JSSE package in the  
jre/lib/ext directory. I have copied the JSSE jar files into the common/lib 
directory and set the JSSE_HOME variable to the common/lib directory. These 
actions does not have any effect.

Interesting enough, the org.apache.catalina.jsp_classpath variable does not 
contain the JSSE packages even though they are stored in the common/lib 
directory. On the other hand, the rest of packages found in the common/lib 
directory are available.

It looks as if catalina ignores the JSSE packages.
creator: mling@ucalgary.ca

text:
One possibility is that you jsse.jar was not detected during the building of your 
Tomcat instance. In such cases, use of https will be disabled in your instance of 
Tomcat.

You can check if the above scenario is applicable to your situation by looking at 
the server/lib/catalina.jar file in your installation and verifying in the 
following class in that jar file:

  org/apache/catalina/net/SSLServerSocketFactory.class

If it is not in catalina.jar, your installation was compiled without jsse.jar.
creator: patrick.luby@planamesa.com

text:
The factory class org/apache/catalina/net/SSLServerSocketFactory.class is 
present in the catalina.jar package. Do I need the factory class
  org/apache/catalina/net/SSLSocketFactory.class
since I need a client socket not a server socket? BTW, since I am not using 
server SSL, I haven't enabled the HTTP SSL Connector. Will that matter?
creator: mling@ucalgary.ca

text:
I got it working. Sorry about the posting. I missed setting the Java options. I 
just exported the environment variable
CATALINA_OPTS=-Djava.protocol.handler.pkgs=com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol
and it works.
creator: mling@ucalgary.ca
